title: Establishes parental notification requirements for environmental health and safety hazards in schools
summary: Requires schools, boards of cooperative educational services and pre-kindergarten programs to provide notification to students, parents and employees of environmental health and safety hazards within school facilities; requires the appointment of information contact persons to ensure the dissemination of such information.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         4148

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to parent notification of
         environmental health and safety hazards in schools

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 409 of the education law is amended by adding a new
    2  subdivision 3 to read as follows:
    3    3. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS SECTION, THE PROVISIONS
    4  OF SECTION FOUR HUNDRED NINE-L OF THIS ARTICLE SHALL APPLY TO ALL SCHOOL
    5  DISTRICTS,  INCLUDING  CITY  SCHOOL  DISTRICTS REGARDLESS OF POPULATION,
    6  BOARDS  OF  COOPERATIVE  EDUCATIONAL   SERVICES   AND   PRE-KINDERGARTEN
    7  PROGRAMS.
    8    S  2.  The  education  law is amended by adding a new section 409-l to
    9  read as follows:
   10    S 409-L.  PARENT  NOTIFICATION  OF  ENVIRONMENTAL  HEALTH  AND  SAFETY
   11  HAZARDS  IN  SCHOOLS.  1. TO ENSURE THAT EACH STUDENT, PARENT, PERSON IN
   12  PARENTAL RELATION AND SCHOOL EMPLOYEE HAS ACCESS  TO  INFORMATION  ABOUT
   13  ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AND HAZARDS IN THEIR SCHOOL ENVIRONMENT, THE
   14  FOLLOWING ACTIONS SHALL BE REQUIRED TO BE TAKEN BY SCHOOLS:
   15    A.  EVERY  SCHOOL DISTRICT SHALL APPOINT AN INFORMATION ACCESS CONTACT
   16  PERSON;
   17    B. AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH SCHOOL YEAR, EVERY SCHOOL SHALL INFORM AND
   18  EDUCATE STUDENTS, PARENTS,  PERSONS  IN  PARENTAL  RELATION  AND  SCHOOL
   19  EMPLOYEES  THAT  THEY  HAVE  A RIGHT TO ALL INFORMATION ABOUT HEALTH AND
   20  SAFETY CONDITIONS  IN  THEIR  SCHOOL  FACILITIES  AS  REQUIRED  IN  THIS
   21  SECTION,  INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES USED, STORED
   22  OR PRESENT IN SCHOOL FACILITIES; CONSTRUCTION AND REHABILITATION  ACTIV-
   23  ITIES;  AIR  OR  WATER QUALITY SAMPLING RESULTS AND PROBLEMS; PROCEDURES
   24  FOR INFORMATION ACCESS;  IDENTIFICATION  OF  SCHOOL  DISTRICT  EMPLOYEES
   25  DESIGNATED  TO SERVE AS INFORMATION ACCESS CONTACT PERSONS; REQUIREMENTS

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05278-01-1

       A. 4148                             2

    1  FOR TIMELY RESPONSE TO INFORMATION REQUESTS; AND OTHER  PROCEDURES  THAT
    2  WILL ENSURE READY ACCESS TO SUCH INFORMATION;
    3    C.    ALL  SCHOOLS,  BOARDS  OF  COOPERATIVE  EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND
    4  PRE-KINDERGARTEN  PROGRAMS  SHALL  ANNUALLY  NOTIFY  STUDENTS,  PARENTS,
    5  PERSONS  IN  PARENTAL  RELATION  AND  SCHOOL  EMPLOYEES OF ALL HAZARDOUS
    6  SUBSTANCES USED, STORED OR PRESENT IN FACILITIES  WITHIN  THEIR  SCHOOL,
    7  INCLUDING ACTIVITIES INVOLVING HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONDUCTED BY PRIVATE
    8  CONTRACTORS.  EACH SCHOOL, BOARD OF COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND
    9  PRE-KINDERGARTEN PROGRAM SHALL:
   10    (I)  ANNUALLY INVENTORY ALL HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES USED, STORED OR PRES-
   11  ENT IN ITS FACILITIES, WHICH INVENTORY SHALL  BE  AVAILABLE  FOR  PUBLIC
   12  REVIEW,
   13    (II)  DEVELOP WRITTEN PLANS TO ELIMINATE OR MINIMIZE THE USE AND PRES-
   14  ENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES IN ITS FACILITIES, INCLUDING A TIMETABLE TO
   15  ACCOMPLISH THE PLAN COMPONENTS, WHICH PLANS HAVE BEEN SUBJECT TO  PUBLIC
   16  REVIEW PRIOR TO ADOPTION, AND
   17    (III)  PREPARE  WRITTEN REPORTS OF THE RESULTS OF ALL SAMPLING, EVALU-
   18  ATION AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES AS APPROPRIATE, SUBMIT SUCH REPORTS  TO
   19  THE  SCHOOL DISTRICT AND THE DEPARTMENT, AND MAKE AVAILABLE SUCH REPORTS
   20  TO THE PUBLIC; AND
   21    D.  EVERY  SCHOOL,  BOARD  OF  COOPERATIVE  EDUCATIONAL  SERVICES  AND
   22  PRE-KINDERGARTEN  PROGRAM  SHALL COMPLY WITH THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS,
   23  AT LEAST TWO SCHOOL DAYS PRIOR TO ANY MAJOR FACILITY CONSTRUCTION, DEMO-
   24  LITION, MAINTENANCE OR RENOVATION, OR ANY OTHER ACTIVITY WITH THE POTEN-
   25  TIAL TO RESULT IN EXPOSURES TO INDOOR OR OUTDOOR HAZARDS THAT MAY HAVE A
   26  SIGNIFICANT EFFECT ON THE HEALTH OF THE OCCUPANTS OF THE FACILITIES:
   27    (I) A WARNING NOTICE SHALL BE PROMINENTLY POSTED AT EACH  ENTRY  POINT
   28  OF  EACH FACILITY AND SCHOOL GROUNDS, WHICH HAS THE FOLLOWING FORMAT AND
   29  INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
   30          "NOTICE OF SCHOOL ACTIVITIES INVOLVING HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES
   31    THE PURPOSE OF THIS  NOTICE  IS  TO  ENSURE  THAT  STUDENTS,  PARENTS,
   32  PERSONS  IN PARENTAL RELATION AND SCHOOL EMPLOYEES ARE NOTIFIED THAT THE
   33  FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL BE OCCURRING IN THIS SCHOOL:
   34  SCHOOL NAME
   35  SCHOOL ADDRESS
   36  PROPOSED ACTIVITY
   37  LOCATION OF PROPOSED ACTIVITY
   38  HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES UTILIZED (IF APPLICABLE)
   39  MATERIAL DATA SAFETY SHEET IS AVAILABLE FROM THE CONTACT PERSON LISTED
   40  BELOW.
   41  DATE/TIME AND DURATION OF PROPOSED ACTIVITY
   42  CONTACT PERSON/LOCATION FOR FURTHER INFORMATION."
   43    (II) SCHOOLS, BOARDS OF COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND  PRE-KIN-
   44  DERGARTEN  PROGRAMS  SHALL  ALSO PROVIDE A WRITTEN NOTICE TO ALL PARENTS
   45  AND PERSONS IN PARENTAL RELATION OF THE INFORMATION SPECIFIED IN SUBPAR-
   46  AGRAPH (I) OF THIS PARAGRAPH.
   47    (III) IF THERE IS NEED FOR AN UNANTICIPATED OR EMERGENCY ACTIVITY,  AS
   48  DEFINED  BY  THE  COMMISSIONER,  PURSUANT TO THIS PARAGRAPH, THE WARNING
   49  NOTICE FORM AND WRITTEN NOTICE MAY BE PROVIDED IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING THE
   50  CONDUCT OF THE ACTIVITY.
   51    (IV) NOTIFICATION SHALL BE PROVIDED TO INDIVIDUALS PURSUANT  TO  THEIR
   52  RIGHTS TO INFORMATION UNDER THE FEDERAL AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT,
   53  THE  INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES EDUCATION ACT, AND SECTION 504 OF THE
   54  REHABILITATION ACT.
   55    2. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING TERMS  ARE  DEFINED  AS
   56  FOLLOWS:

       A. 4148                             3

    1    A.  "HAZARDOUS  SUBSTANCES" SHALL MEAN AND INCLUDE LEAD, RADON, ASBES-
    2  TOS, FORMALDEHYDE, PRODUCTS CONTAINING GREATER THAN TEN PERCENT VOLATILE
    3  ORGANIC COMPOUNDS AND ANY SUBSTANCE LISTED AS A SUBSTANCE  HAZARDOUS  TO
    4  THE  PUBLIC HEALTH, SAFETY OR THE ENVIRONMENT IN REGULATIONS PROMULGATED
    5  PURSUANT TO ARTICLE THIRTY-SEVEN OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION LAW.
    6    B.  "FACILITY"  SHALL  MEAN SCHOOL BUILDINGS, LANDS AND OTHER APPURTE-
    7  NANCES  OF  A  SCHOOL  DISTRICT  OR  BOARD  OF  COOPERATIVE  EDUCATIONAL
    8  SERVICES.
    9    C.  "INFORMATION  ACCESS  CONTACT PERSON" SHALL MEAN A SCHOOL DISTRICT
   10  EMPLOYEE, APPOINTED  BY  THE  SUPERINTENDENT,  WHO  IS  RESPONSIBLE  FOR
   11  PROVIDING   INFORMATION   ON  SCHOOL  ENVIRONMENTAL  HEALTH  AND  SAFETY
   12  REQUESTED BY ANY INDIVIDUAL RESIDING IN THE SCHOOL DISTRICT OR BOARD  OF
   13  COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES.
   14    S  3.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
   15  have become a law.
